Colophon

By Zinzy Waleson Geene, last updated on November 26, 2022

This is a personal website, designed, built, and maintained by me, Zinzy.

About this space

  • This website is casual, unpretentious, and unassuming.
  • On here, you‚Äôll find soft stances, lived experiences, and critical notes on the things I hold dear.
  • It‚Äôs organized as a casual collection of unfinished thoughts.
  • This website lacks an archive or central index. Instead, it‚Äôs a collection of linked files. I like that this is essentially a scavenger hunt.
  • I use this website to participate in the IndieWeb, a great community of people who enjoy tinkering on personal websites, as well as independence while they do so.

Technical details

  • This website is built in Jekyll, a flat-file content management system I‚Äôve been using for years. I like my familiarity with the platform, as well as the light-weight nature of flat-file systems.
  • I‚Äôve taken Maxime Vaillancourt digital garden template for Jekyll as my starting point. I continue to change it on an almost daily basis.
  • The font you‚Äôre looking at is whatever is native to your operating system.
  • I‚Äôve borrowed elements from Clay Harmon‚Äôs Tufte Jekyll theme to achieve a particular style of sidenotes originating from the work of Edward Tufte.

To do on this website

Changelog

  • 2022-11-19:
    • Added Indieweb post types article, note, and reply
    • Added outgoing webmentions
  • 2022-11-20: added cross-post type support for bidirectional links (thanks to this)
  • 2022-11-21:
    • Added git submodule for Obsidian content
    • Added Netlify hook to check content submodule for updates on build

Zinzy Waleson Geene (she/ they) is a researcher, designer, and queer facilitator from Amsterdam. She's interested in humanities and behavioral sciences, yoga practice, and amateur cooking. She engages in mellow cultural and critical analysis, linking and tinkering on her personal website, zinzy.website .
